SELECT user_id userId, class_id classId, apr_yn aprYn, nm snm, birth, phone, email FROM user WHERE role = "ROLE_STD" AND apr_yn = 0 AND del_yn = 0 AND class_id = #{classId}
mapper.update: UPDATE user SET apr_yn = 1 WHERE user_id = #{userId} AND del_yn = 0
mapper.select: SELECT COUNT(C.class_id) classid FROM van A INNER JOIN school B ON A.school_id = B.school_id INNER JOIN user C ON A.class_id = C.class_id WHERE C.class_id = #{classid} AND C.role ="ROLE_STD" and apr_yn = 1 and del_yn = 0

select D.nm cateNm,B.rating rating, count(B.rating) as percentage from user A INNER JOIN aca_result B ON A.user_id = B.user_id INNER JOIN subject C ON B.subject_id = C.subject_id INNER JOIN sbj_category D on C.category_id = D.category_id where A.apr_yn=1 and A.role = 'ROLE_STD' and C.category_id = #{categoryId} and A.class_id =#{classId} and concat(year,semester,mid_final) = ( SELECT MAX(concat(YEAR, semester, mid_final)) FROM aca_result) group by rating
